column4: i'm using ubuntu 10.10 When i get to the logon screen to type the password, i cannot type anything. Even when i use the on-screen keyboard, nothing appears. therefore, i am unable to log on. Why?
i really need help. I need my computer for my exam later!
i'm using ubuntu 10.10 When i get to the logon screen to type the password, i cannot type anything. Even when i use the on-screen keyboard, nothing appears. therefore, i am unable to log on. Why?
what exactly is the case?
i'm using ubuntu 10.10 When i get to the logon screen to type the password, i cannot type anything. Even when i use the on-screen keyboard, nothing appears. therefore, i am unable to log on. I
switch to a virtual terminal and see if your keyboard works there?
when i start in recovery mode and use the terminal it works. but at the logon screen i can't even press ctrl-alt-f1 to open the terminal
does the caps indicator come on?
like ganon asked lap or desk?
you cannot do ctrl-alt-F1 even now?
then do reboot in recovery mode and start gdm and see if any error message or so comes up
have you used any ubuntu version prior to this?
it didnt work. it started up the logon screen again and i still couldnt type
i'm not sure
i'm really not sure what the problem is what have been your last actions on the ubuntu before this problem?
i was having problems with wine. so i downgraded some packages to install wine. and now when i started it up again this morning, this happened
i did "sudo dpkg-reconfigure console-setup" and selected the stuff i needed. is there one for the gdm? cos even the on-screen keyboard cannot type anything
any ideas how to fix kbd configure?
not sure about that idea though
it may come to that but once your terminal responds in recovery mode i guess you should boot in recovery mode and continue in recovery mode and try to reconfigure gdm
terminal works in recovery mode
